耳.definition: ear; handle (archaeology); and that is all (Classical Chinese)

耳下腺.definition: subauricular gland; parotid gland (salivary gland in the cheek)

耳光.definition: a slap on the face; CL:記|记[ji4]

耳刮子.definition: (coll.) a slap on one's face; a cuff

耳墜子.definition: eardrops (pendant jewelry); earrings; CL:對|对[dui4],隻|只[zhi1]

耳提面命.definition: to give sincere advice (idiom); to exhort earnestly

耳旁風.definition: lit. wind past your ear; fig. sth you don't pay much attention to; in one ear and out the other

耳朵.definition: ear; CL:隻|只[zhi1],個|个[ge4],對|对[dui4]; handle (on a cup)

耳朵眼兒.definition: earhole; ear piercing hole; earring hole

耳根.definition: base of the ear; ear; (Buddhism) sense of hearing

耳根清淨.definition: lit. ears pure and peaceful (idiom); to stay away from the filth and unrest of the world

耳熟能詳.definition: what's frequently heard can be repeated in detail (idiom)

耳目.definition: eyes and ears; sb's attention or notice; information; knowledge; spies

耳目一新.definition: a pleasant change; a breath of fresh air; refreshing

耳聞.definition: to hear of; to hear about

耳聞不如目見.pinyin: ěr wén bù rú mù jiàn
耳聞不如目見.definition: seeing sth for oneself is better than hearing about it from others

耳聰目明.definition: sharp ears and keen eyes (idiom); keen and alert; perceptive

耳聽為虛，眼見為實.pinyin: ěr tīng wèi xū ， yǎn jiàn wèi shí
耳聽為虛，眼見為實.definition: (idiom) you cannot always trust what you hear, but seeing is believing

耳膜.definition: eardrum; tympanum (of the middle ear); tympanic membrane

耳語.definition: to whisper in sb's ear; a whisper

耳返.definition: in-ear monitor (abbr. for 耳機返聽系統|耳机返听系统[er3ji1 fan3ting1 xi4tong3]) (contrasted with 地返[di4fan3])

耳邊風.definition: lit. wind past your ear; fig. sth you don't pay much attention to; in one ear and out the other

耳髮.definition: (men) sideburns; (women) lengths of hair that hang down over the temples

耳鬢廝磨.definition: lit. to play together ear to ear and temple to temple (idiom); fig. (of a boy and a girl) to play together often during childhood

耳鼓.definition: eardrum; tympanum (of the middle ear); tympanic membrane
